Package org.digijava.module.calendar.action

  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    CalendarPaginationAction
    Title:
    ConfirmCalendarItems
    Action displayes confirmation page for selected event items, status of which is being changed
    CreateCalendarItem
    Action creates new event item and saves it into database
    DeleteEvent
    Title:
    EditCalendarItem
    Action edits an existing event item identified by activeCalendarItem identity(if not null), updates it into database and redirects back to the action from which it was invoked
    OrganisationSelected  
    PreviewCalendarEvent  
    PreviewCalendarEventDone  
    PreviewCalendarItem
    Action Previews the event before publcation
    RecurringEvent  
    RenderTeaser
    Renders Calendar Teaser
    SearchOrganisation  
    ShowCalendarEvent  
    ShowCalendarItemDetails
    Action displayes details of event item identified by activeCalendarItem identity(if not null)
    ShowCalendarItems
    Action displayes events according to the selected status defined by FormBean property - status, action redirects back to the action, which invoked it
    ShowCalendarItemsSettings
    Action displayes Calendar Settings page
    ShowCalendarView  
    ShowColorPalete  
    ShowCreateCalendarItem
    Action renders form, whith which new event is created
    ShowEditCalendarItem
    Action renders form, whith which existing event item identified by activeCalendarItem identity (if not null) can be updated
    ShowEvents  
    UpdateCalendarItemsSettings
    Action updates event items settings into database
    UpdateConfirmCalendarItems
    Action updates selected events statuses into database, sends appropriate notification email alerts to event's authors and redirects back to the action from which it was invoked
    ViewEvents
    Action determines default view for Calendar and redirects to default view
    ViewListEvents
    Action displayes events in List View
    ViewMonthEvents
    Action displayes events in Month View
    ViewYearEvents
    Action displayes events in Year View
